qas.question: How long have Christians made up nearly 1/3rd of the population?
Which Christian denomination has the most members?
How many people today are Roman Catholics?
As of when did Christianity have about 2.4 million adherents?
Which religion is the smallest in the world?
For how long have Christians made up about 50% of the world's population?
Which is the smallest Christian denomination?
Which denomination of Christianity has 1.17 million followers?

context: As of the <b3_0>early 21st century<b3_0/>, <b4_0>Christianity<b4_0/> has approximately 2.4 billion adherents. The faith represents about a third of the world's population and is the largest religion in the world. Christians have composed about 33 percent of the world's population for <b5_0>around <a0_0>100 years<b5_0/><a0_0/>. The largest Christian denomination is the <a1_0><b6_0><b7_0>Roman Catholic Church<b7_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/>, with <a2_0>1.17 billion<a2_0/> adherents, representing half of all Christians.
